results.title: Eric Worrell: they don't shoot bathtubs
results.brief_description: Part of the “See it my way” series, in this program Eric Worrell outlines his views on conservation of the environment, based on the premise that, if the individual starts to rebuild the ecological balance of their own garden, they will encourage others such as business organisations, councils and governments to follow suit on a wider scale. He gives several examples of companies that have established sanctuary areas for the animal population side by side with areas used for economic purposes. He also cites other examples where the environment has been totally destroyed in the pursuit of economic expansion.

results.title: Spotlights: Eric Bana
results.brief_description: Eric Banadinović AM, known professionally as Eric Bana, is an Australian actor. He began his career in the sketch comedy series Full Frontal (1993–97) before gaining notice in the comedy/drama The Castle (1997) before gaining critical acclaim as the lead in Chopper (2000).

constellations_primary.name: Eric Bana
constellations_primary.description: There must be something that draws Australian creatives like Eric Bana to darker material as they shoot to stardom overseas. Australia's penal colony past perhaps?

results.description: Eric Bana is an Australian actor who began his career in the sketch comedy series Full Frontal (1993–97) before gaining notice in the comedy/drama The Castle (1997). Soon after he gained critical recognition in the biographical crime film Chopper (2000). Eric discusses the influence of the car on the Australian psyche.
description_for_label: Eric Bana is an Australian actor who began his career in the sketch comedy series Full Frontal (1993–97) before gaining notice in the comedy/drama The Castle (1997). Soon after he gained critical recognition in the biographical crime film Chopper (2000). Eric discusses the influence of the car on the Australian psyche.

results.title: Eric & Ernie's Xmas Show = The Morecambe & Wise Christmas Show
results.brief_description: A selection of comedy sketches by one of Britain’s favourite TV comedy duos, Eric Morecambe and Ernie Wise, from their Christmas shows. Guests include Peter Barkworth, Peter Cushing, Hannah Gordon, Glenda Jackson, Mick McManus, Gemma Craven, Jill Gascoine, Sir Alec Guinness, Peter Vaughan.

results.title: Ergonomics: the practical approach
results.brief_description: Ergonomics is the study of the relationship between people, the equipment they use, and the physical environment in which they work. Ergonomics is a continuous process which aims to improve productivity and health through practical measures which reduce difficult situations. This program and guide looks at how ergonomics is applied, static and dynamic muscular effort, visual controls and displays, as well as a follow up questionnaire.

results.title: Eraserhead
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Lynch/Frost Productions and American Film Institute
results.brief_description: Lynch’s debut film has been re-released with a new print and stereo mix soundtrack. Opinion is divided as to film’s brilliance but over the years it has achieved cult status in it’s genre. Shot in black and white with an incredible soundtrack and tight script, ‘Eraserhead’ is the story of a timid printer Henry Spencer (John Nance) who lives in an apartment building trying to figure out what to do with his horribly mutated son. Lynch described the film as ” a dream of dark and troubling things.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Lynch, Lynch/Frost Productions and American Film Institute

results.title: Eradicate the enemy
results.creator_credit: Mushir Ahmad, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Advocates the popularising of the BCG vaccine to fight tuberculosis. BCG or Bacillus Calmette Guerin was developed at the Pasteur Institute in Paris after many years of research. It was first tested on human beings in 1921 and proved an inexpensive, speedy and effective method for the prevention and eradication of tuberculosis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mushir Ahmad, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: ERA : the Educational Reform Association School (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film gives an impression of the philosophies, day-to-day experiences and development of pupils at the Education Reform Association School at Donvale, Victoria. Students and staff together discuss the aims of the school programme, hopefully providing evidence for greater freedom in all our educational institutions

results.title: ER
results.brief_description: Explores the inner workings of an urban teaching hospital and the critical issues faced by the dedicated physicians and staff of its overburdened emergency room.
